relation: University Police do an excellent job of keeping us safe. There is also private security that is hired for events. They do everything they can to make sure that crime stays low on campus.
This is the most affordable University that I know of. And you definitely get a great education for the cost.
There are so many different on campus activities and clubs, that you are going to be able to find something that fits your own likes. Just this semester alone, 103 new clubs were chartered.
The dining services are exceptional. There is something for everyone. Whether you are Vegan, Vegetarian or prefer to have a lot of meat and sweets, there is a lot to choose from.
There are a lot of great housing options on and off campus.

If you want to be challenged, there are some great honors classes available. Even in the beginning level courses, you will find that there are some that will challenge you to stretch yourself, grow and develop.
Take your time to get to know your way around campus, it makes finding classes easier. Don't stress out during your first semesters, you will find your own groove fast enough.
A fantastic University that offers diversity, variety, and a lot of opportunity to learn.
pageTitle: Utah Valley University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {891188=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 851650=It isn't too bad. I paid $2600 for this semester and the last 2 semesters were also about the same price., 268577=Most classes were pretty easy. The only really difficult class was physical science 1000 and it was mainly because the professor was really old and confusing., 11354=I ended up having to take a year off to get Utah residency because out of state tuition was so expensive, but after starting school here, I can tell you it was way worth it. I'm a full-time student and my tuition ends up around 2400 after my class and lab fees. And it's worth every dollar. I am learning more than I am paying., 449873=I really like how close this college is to my home. It would be easy access and it offers classes I believe I would enjoy taking. I look forward to attending this school in the fall of 2013., 479389=May be it's just me, but having roommates can be a bit of a hassle. Some roommates are responsible and others may not, but to bad you have to suck it up. Because you can't afford something better for yourself., 47581=A lot of the classes are really great. I would suggest that Music Majors don't seriously look at this school. The music program isn't very good. Beware! The Biology 1010 class is the most flunked class at the school. Taking lab is optional, but I highly recommend that you take this at the same time. It will help significantly., 797581=Probably one of the cheaper universities in the state of Utah. Tuition my last two semesters was around 2500-2700., 3655=First of all, this HAS to be one of the least expensive schools in the US! My tuition is usually around $2500 a semester, but that's for 19 credit hours... For 9, it's more like $1200. But think of it this way: Not only are you paying for an instructor, you're paying for a friend, and possibly a future reference/stepping stool into the career of your choice... It's not half bad.}

textAfterTable: This campus is... unique :) It's made mostly out of concrete, glass and colorful pipes. It's incredibly easy to get around, and there are always some activity going on! If you don't have a date for the weekend, you can always expect to have a a good array of fun, alternative options. Am learning a lot I LOVE going to school here! The Professors are fantastic! Every class I have had thus far has been taught by highly respected individuals; everyone has at least one Master's and they have all had experience working in their field! The class room sizes are fairly small; the largest I've had contained 25 students. The Professors are easy to talk to and **Remember your name**!! Login to rate or flag the reviews Nicholas from Colorado Springs, CO 07/10/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 8 out of 8 people found this review useful. 3 of 219 Categories Comments Great for these types of students
